title: FPTAS for Holant Problems with Log-Concave Signatures
authors: Kun He, Zhidan Li, Guoliang Qiu and Chihao Zhang
abstract:
For an integer $b\ge 0$, a $b$-matching in a graph $G=(V,E)$ is a set
$S\subseteq E$ such that each vertex $v\in V$ is incident to at most $b$ edges
in $S$. We design a fully polynomial-time approximation scheme (FPTAS) for
counting the number of $b$-matchings in graphs with bounded degrees. Our FPTAS
also applies to a broader family of counting problems, namely Holant problems
with log-concave signatures. Our algorithm is based on Moitra's linear
programming approach (JACM'19). Using a novel construction called the extended
coupling tree, we derandomize the coupling designed by Chen and Gu (SODA'24).
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Data Structures and Algorithms
